verses.text: For you are commanded even to honour the chair of Moses, and that although they who occupy it are accounted sinners.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 70:6
verses.text: And now I have said enough to you; and I deem it superfluous to say to him how he is to live unblameably, since he is an approved disciple of Him who taught me also.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 71:1
verses.text: Chapter LXXI.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 71:2
verses.text: —Various Duties of Christians.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 71:3
verses.text: "But, brethren, there are some things that you must not wait to hear, but must consider of yourselves what is reasonable.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 71:4
verses.text: Zacchaeus alone having given himself up wholly to labour for you, and needing sustenance, and not being able to attend to his own affairs, how can he procure necessary support?  Is it not reasonable that you are to take forethought for his living? not waiting for his asking you, for this is the part of a beggar.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 71:5
verses.text: But he will rather die of hunger than submit to do this.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 71:6
verses.text: And shall not you incur punishment, not considering that the workman is worthy of his hire?  And let no one say:  Is, then, the word sold which was freely given?  Far be it.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 71:7
verses.text: For if any one has the means of living, and takes anything, he sells the word; but if he who has not takes support in order to live—as the Lord also took at supper and among His friends, having nothing, though He alone is the owner of all things—he sins not.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 71:8
verses.text: Therefore suitably honour elders, catechists, useful deacons, widows who have lived well, orphans as children of the Church.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 71:9
verses.text: But wherever there is need of any provision for an emergency, contribute all together.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 71:10
verses.text: Be kind one to another, not shrinking from the endurance of anything whatever for your own salvation".

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 72:1
verses.text: Chapter LXXII.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 72:2
verses.text: —Ordination.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 72:3
verses.text: And having thus spoken, he placed his hand upon Zacchaeus, saying, "O Thou Ruler and Lord of all, Father and God, do Thou guard the shepherd with the flock.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 72:4
verses.text: Thou art the cause, Thou the power.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 72:5
verses.text: We are that which is helped; Thou the helper, the physician, the saviour, the wall, the life, the hope, the refuge, the joy, the expectation, the rest.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 72:6
verses.text: In a word, Thou art all things to us.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 72:7
verses.text: In order to the eternal attainment of salvation, do Thou co-operate, preserve, protect.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 72:8
verses.text: Thou canst do all things.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 72:9
verses.text: For Thou art the Ruler of rulers, the Lord of lords, the Governor of kings.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 72:10
verses.text: Do Thou give power to the president to loose what ought to be loosed, to bind what ought to be bound.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 72:11
verses.text: Do Thou make him wise.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 72:12
verses.text: Do Thou, as by His name, protect the Church of Thy Christ as a fair bride.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 72:13
verses.text: For Thine is eternal glory.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 72:14
verses.text: Praise to the Father and the Son and the Holy Ghost to all ages,  Amen".

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 73:1
verses.text: Chapter LXXIII.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 73:2
verses.text: —Baptisms.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 73:3
verses.text: And having thus spoken, he afterwards said:  "Whoever of you wish to be baptized, begin from to-morrow to fast, and have hands laid upon you day by day, and inquire about what matters you please.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 73:4
verses.text: For I mean still to remain with you ten days".

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 73:5
verses.text: And after three days, having begun to baptize, he called me, and Aquila, and Nicetas, and said to us:  "As I am going to set out for Tyre after seven days, I wish you to go away this very day, and to lodge secretly with Bernice the Canaanite, the daughter of Justa, and to learn from her, and write accurately to me what Simon is about.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 73:6
verses.text: For this is of great consequence to me, that I may prepare myself accordingly.

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 73:7
verses.text: Therefore depart straightway in peace".

verses.name: Clement: Homily III 73:8
verses.text: And leaving him baptizing, as he commanded, we preceded him to Tyre of Phoenicia.
